docs.lead_paragraph: Democrats hope the measure, approved on a bipartisan vote of 68 to 29, will be the first in a series of bills spurring employment by providing hiring incentives to businesses.

byline.contributor: Sewell Chan and Janie Lorber contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: My Thursday column argues that the crucial element of health care reform is its effort to increase access to the uninsured. Of course, I think it's also crucial to hold down costs -- that helps assure access in the long run -- and I think that the Obama plan will help curb costs in the long run. I would have loved to see tort reform part of the package, but even the legislation's promotion of research into which medical interventions work will over time presumably lead to some cost savings.

headline.main: A Broader View of Health Care

docs.abstract: We tend to be dazzled by breakthroughs in medical technologies. But often the greatest benefits come from public health measures -- seatbelts, or the ban on lead paint -- and from increasing access to the medical system. And increasing access is the reason we desperately need health care reform to pass this year.

docs.lead_paragraph: The drive to pass health care legislation intersected on Wednesday with calls for President Obama's proposed overhaul of the student loan system.

headline.main: Democrats Press Ahead With Student Loan Overhaul

docs.abstract: The health care system and student loan program are both "broken" and "unsustainable," a House Democrat said on Wednesday.
docs.snippet: The health care system and student loan program are both "broken" and "unsustainable," a House Democrat said on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, urged Congress on Wednesday to let the Fed keep all of its banking oversight, arguing that information gleaned from that process helped the central bank guide the economy, The Associated Press reports.

headline.main: Bernanke Defends Fed's Banking Oversight Role

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama has sent an e-mail message thanking members of his Organizing for America group for their efforts in building support for the Democrats' health care legislation.

headline.main: Obama: Everything Is on the Line

docs.lead_paragraph: Say you're a House Democrat, wondering whether to vote for President Obama's health care bill. Representative Henry A. Waxman has some data for you.

headline.main: District by District, Data on Health Care

docs.abstract: As Democratic leaders round up votes for the health care legislation, a committee chairman invites lawmakers and their constituents to click for a picture of the bill's local effects.

docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Dale Kildee, Democrat of Michigan and a strong opponent of abortion, announced on Wednesday that he was satisfied with the provisions in the Senate-passed health care bill that seek to limit the use of federal money for insurance coverage of abortion.

headline.main: Stupak Ally in House Approves Senate Abortion Restrictions

docs.abstract: An opponent of abortion rights and ally of Representative Bart Stupak endorsed the Senate's restrictions on abortion.
docs.snippet: An opponent of abortion rights and ally of Representative Bart Stupak endorsed the Senate's restrictions on abortion.

docs.lead_paragraph: The usual suspects have been attacking Obama for "demonizing" insurance companies; but saying that people do terrible things isn't demonization if they do, in fact, do terrible things.
docs.abstract: Right now, we have a system that creates huge incentives for bad, one might say demonic, behavior.
